Class Parabola

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.mathematics.geometry.curves.Parabola
public class Parabola extends Object
Represents a parabola in 2D space.

A parabola is defined by the equation: y = a(x-h)Â² + k where (h,k) is the vertex and a determines the shape.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Parabola(double vertexX, double vertexY, double a)
    Creates a parabola with vertex at (h, k) and coefficient a.
    Parabola(double vertexX, double vertexY, double a, double rotation)
    Creates a rotated parabola.

    Method
    Description
    boolean
    containsPoint(Point2D p, double tolerance)
    Checks if a point is on the parabola (within tolerance).

    Returns the derivative dy/dx at point x.

    Evaluates y for a given x (non-rotated parabola).
